text: okay okay okay okay hi everyone music
agenda here the internet's busiest music
nerd and it's time for a review of the
new slow tie album
ugly this is the newest full-length LP
from UK rapper singer and songwriter
slow tie his third full-length LP today
following 2021's Tyron which was a short
but interesting double album of sorts
that show the Northampton native
splitting the more aggressive and
introspective sides of his personality
the snappier and sadder parts of his
sound which was a personal change of
pace from the sharp social commentary on
many tracks from his breakout DB record
which I highly recommend if you haven't
heard it but now moving from Tyron ugly
feels like a deeper and even more
unforgiving dive into the mind of slow
tie because on that double LP it really
was the second half that carried the
most emotional weight and ugly feels
like an even more aggressive
presentation of what's eating at him
delivered over a musical backdrop that
at least feels partially new for slow
tie with mortgage guitars more drums
more live instrumentation more noise and
more Distortion as well which a few key
names helped bring to life there's Jacob
bugden who typically does guitars for
Biba doobie also Taylor Sky of jockstrap
the fontaine's DC boys are in the mix
too among a few others and the end
result is slow ties wildest and most
unencumbered record yet there just
seemed to be no limitations on this
project sonically and especially
emotionally there's the opening track
yum which is some really jittery
industrial hip-hop with whiffs of The
Prodigy and Death Grips in the mix at
least on the instrumental anyway there's
a lot of tense throbbing beats and bass
on this thing stuttering synthesizers
shots of noise too all setting the stage
for what feels like less of a Song and
more of a reenactment of slow ties
descent into Insanity demanding an
intervention talking about a lack of
motivation his addictions his impulsive
behavior his anger issues and generally
sounding out of his damn mind as he does
it with Scream items with heavy
breathing I think this is the most
unfiltered he's been in his music so far
in terms of intensity and intrusive
thoughts and it's good that the album
starts this way because if you're not
into it I would say turn back now the
song selfish brings another interesting
change of pace with some crisp and
driving Rock drums haunting fragments of
keys and some distorted samples flying
in here and there which makes the
perfect setting for slow ties clenched
tooth diatribes about selfishness which
he seemingly Embraces aspects of but
simultaneously he comes off angry as
being characterized as such by people
who are jealous of his success and
attempts at self-preservation the song
sooner I found to be one of the milder
cuts on here in terms of sound and
performance there are some looping Rock
riffs on this thing that are just okay
the sound of the track overall feels
like I'm listening to some Punky Pub
Rock with a lot of group vocals a rapid
fire flurry of thoughts and emotions on
the verses too the general Vibe of the
track is okay but as a song It Doesn't
really stick with me feel good by AI
comparison I found to be much catchier
and kind of a standout in terms of
emotion and attitude as well as what we
have here are some very silly Carefree
Post Punk about letting loose and
feeling alive which in a sense may be
pure escapism and temporary Euphoria but
it is nice that slow tie put this
visceral Oasis in the middle of a very
dark project the black humor coming off
the lyrics on this track also leaves it
feeling yes upbeat but also pretty dark
I just wish there was another verse to
the track especially considering the one
that's on here is so good the following
never again is the heart-wrenching story
of a woman that slow tie used to be with
at some point their lives seemingly
drifted apart he still clearly has
feelings for her and continues to tell
her story uh till we reach a very tragic
end I don't necessarily want to spoil
but this song contains easily the most
devastating story to come out of any
slow tie track and I really have to lock
myself down emotionally for this track
to just not blow me to Smithereens every
time I hear it the following [ __ ] a
puppet is maybe the first cut on this
project that feels like a true blue
hip-hop song it's like a menacing piece
of 90s psycho rap with slow tie rap
arguing with the voices in his own head
in a way as he drops slick rhyme schemes
about drugs dreaming his own death it's
kind of short but still hits and the
back and forth between him and the other
voice that he's talking to is pretty
interesting happy is one of the
snappiest rock oriented songs on the
entire LP which honestly is one of the
saddest moments here personally you may
not think that due to its really
infectious refrains it's okay okay
but beyond these Moody riffs and shouty
refrains we have a picture of a man who
is willing to do anything for a bit of
peace and happiness the title track of
this LP also spells out its title as the
hook with all these various voices
layering up to announce the spelling of
ugly that's just sound like the various
emotions going on slow Ty's head all
competing to be heard the overwhelming
walls of guitar on this track combined
with all the chaotic overdubs hanging in
the background this track really feels
like slow tie spiraling at this point
which is why I think the following track
falling is uh so appropriate in terms of
sequence because it really does sound
like slow tie is losing himself to
something on this song and it's so
impressive and so intense and memorable
despite the fact that the drumby and
chords come across as so common which
just goes to show that a lot of the
appeal in a song can come down to the
performance because it's really hard to
not get caught up in what slow tie is
bringing here in terms of emotion as he
screams about drifting away throughout
much of the song Meanwhile the muddy
guitar Distortion and floor tom heavy
beats on what's funny brings a sound
that feels like a classic piece of late
70s UK punk rock this one brings some of
the most pointed social commentary on
the entire record with each verse
bringing a different Twisted tale or
scenario and basically asks the audience
what's so funny or what's there to laugh
about in such a dark world then
tourniquet is a truly tragic Peak for
the project the performance here is so
extreme it's so emotionally potent it's
kind of like a tortured void that's
genuinely difficult to stare into we
then have a pretty nice acoustic cut to
close things out that brings like a
hopeful calm after the storm of really
this entire record so far with winding
Melodies Angelic background vocals a
stunningly beautiful chorus as well that
brings kind of a sweet sentiment of yes
um flawed yes I'm broken bad things have
happened but there is an opportunity
here for growth change healing
Redemption putting things back together
and slow tie delivers this with verses
that are a mix of rapping singing and
spoken word that feel unique to him
unique to this record and again an
interestingly positive note to end
things on for an album that is primarily
so dark but I think that's because this
album the pain the suffering isn't the
point like this thing isn't certainly
fetishizing the feelings uh portrayed
here no this project is more about uh
the desire to overcome these feelings or
escape from them and I think slow tie
does a great job of accurately capturing
the trials of self-loathing trauma
loneliness and volatility that one feels
when dealing with mental health issues
and does it so succinctly as well
because this record isn't really all
that bloated it doesn't overstay it's
welcome it's complex emotionally but
also to the point with a dynamic
instrumental palette that he really did
take a risk on a risk I think panned out
pretty well feeling a strong eight on
this one transition have you given this
album a listen did you love it did you
hate it what would you rate it you're
the best you're the best what should I
review next hit the like if you like
Please Subscribe and please don't cry
hit the Bell as well over here next to
my head is another video you can check
out hit that up or the link to subscribe
to the channel Anthony fantano slow tie
forever
